questions: Why are we on earth?
answer: To find the Divine who is in each of us and in all things.

questions: What is truly important in life?
What is the one thing that matters most?
answer: Only one thing is important, it is to find the Divine. For each one and for the whole world anything becomes useful if it helps to find the Divine.

questions: What is the true aim of life?
What is life's fundamental purpose?
answer: The true aim of life is to find the Divine's Presence deep inside oneself and to surrender to It so that It takes the lead of the life, all the feelings and all the actions of the body. This gives a true and luminous aim to existence.

questions: What is my true destiny?
answer: The true destiny is to reach the Divine Consciousness.

questions: What is my true worth in this life?
answer: To serve the Divine. The only thing worth living for is to serve the Divine.

questions: I feel alone, what should I remember?
Is the Divine with me when I feel lonely?
answer: Never forget that you are not alone. The Divine is with you helping and guiding you. He is the companion who never fails, the friend whose love comforts and strengthens. The more you feel lonely, the more you are ready to perceive His luminous Presence. Have faith and He will do everything for you.

questions: What is God?
answer: God is the perfection that we must aspire to realise. The Divine is the perfection towards which we move.

questions: Who am I?
answer: The Divine under many disguises.

questions: How can we open ourselves to the Infinite?
How do we allow the Infinite to enter us?
answer: Our human consciousness has windows that open on the Infinite but generally men keep these windows carefully shut. They have to be opened wide and allow the Infinite freely to enter into us and transform us. Two conditions are necessary for opening the windows: 1) ardent aspiration; 2) progressive dissolution of the ego. The Divine help is assured to those who set to work sincerely.

questions: What is the best method to find the Divine within us?
answer: Aspiration. Silence. Concentration in the solar plexus region. If need be, a prayer addressed to the Divine: I belong to You and I want to know You so that all that I do is nothing but what you want me to do.

questions: What is sincerity?
How can one be truly sincere according to you?
answer: Sincerity is the key of the divine doors. Sincerity means to lift all the movements of the being to the level of the highest consciousness and realisation already attained. Sincerity exacts the unification and harmonisation of the whole being in all its parts and movements around the central Divine Will.

questions: What is meant by a sincere aspiration?
answer: An aspiration which is not mixed with any interested and egoistic calculation.

questions: What is faith?
Can you define the nature of true faith?
answer: Faith is spontaneous knowledge in the psychic. It is a certitude which is not necessarily based on experience and knowledge. True faith means confidence in the Divine and the unshakable certitude of the Divine's Victory.

questions: What is the difference between an ardent aspiration and pulling down force?
answer: It is the vital that pulls down and the psychic that aspires.

questions: What is the rationale of Divine Grace?
Is the Supreme Mother always ready with Her Grace?
answer: Yes. The Divine Grace cannot be explained through words and mental formulas. The Grace is equally for all. But each one receives it according to his sincerity. It does not depend on outward circumstances but on a sincere aspiration and openness.

questions: What does anxiety signify?
Why do I often feel anxious?
answer: Anxiety is a lack of confidence in the Divine's Grace, the unmistakable sign that the consecration is not complete and perfect.

questions: How can I avoid attacks of depression?
answer: Do not pay attention to the depression and act as if it was not there. Indeed, depression is the worst of all illnesses and we must reject it with as much energy as we use to get rid of a disease.

questions: What is your view on fear?
Should I listen to my fears?
answer: Fear is always a very bad adviser. Without fear *nothing* can happen. Yoga and fear do not go together. All fear must be overcome and replaced by a total confidence in the Divine Grace.

questions: What is the true purpose of life for an individual?
answer: To live for the Divine, or to live for the Truth, or at least to live for one's soul. And the true sincerity is to live for the Divine without expecting any benefit from Him in return.

questions: How should I deal with difficulties in life?
answer: The best way of meeting difficulties is a quiet and calm confidence in the Grace. For those who have given themselves to the Divine each difficulty that confronts them is the assurance of a new progress and thus must be taken as a gift from the Grace.

questions: When does one choose the spiritual path?
What makes someone ready for spiritual life?
answer: You take up the spiritual path only when you feel you cannot do otherwise.

questions: What is needed to follow the spiritual path to the end?
answer: To follow the path to the end, one must be armed with a very patient endurance.

questions: What is the perfect path in spirituality?
answer: The perfect path: for each one the path which leads fastest to the Divine.

questions: How does doing Yoga bring you near to the Divine?
What is the real meaning of Yoga?
answer: Yoga is not only an aspiration of the mind towards the Divine but also and chiefly a yearning of the heart.

questions: What is the effect of practicing Yoga in relation to world transformation?
answer: The whole world is in a process of progressive transformation; if you take up the discipline of Yoga, you speed up in yourself the process.

questions: What is Sri Aurobindo's view on the world and its purpose?
answer: The world as it is, is not the divine creation it is meant to be, but an obscure and perverted expression of it. It is not the expression of the divine consciousness and will, but this is what it is meant to become; it has been created to develop into a perfect manifestation of the Divine under all His forms and aspects—Light and Knowledge, power, Love and Beauty. This is our conception of it and the aim we follow.

questions: How does Sri Aurobindo's sadhana differ from traditional sadhanas?
answer: The usual sadhanas have for aim the union with the Supreme Consciousness (Sat-chit-ananda). And those who reach there are satisfied with their own liberation and leave the world to its unhappy plight. On the contrary, Sri Aurobindo's sadhana starts where the others end. Once the union with the Supreme is realised one must bring down that realisation to the exterior world and change the conditions of life upon the earth until a total transformation is accomplished.

questions: What conduct is advised for those practicing Integral Yoga regarding certain habits?
answer: To those who want to practise the integral Yoga, it is strongly advised to abstain from three things: 1) Sexual intercourse 2) Smoking 3) Drinking alcohol.

questions: In Integral Yoga, what is more important: the action itself or the spirit behind it?
answer: It is not what you do but the spirit in which you do it that is important for the integral Yoga.

questions: In Yoga, what truly matters: the action or the consciousness in which it is done?
answer: From the standpoint of Yoga it is not so much what you do but how you do it that matters most. It is not so much the act that matters, but the consciousness in which it is done.

questions: Do I have the capacity to follow the spiritual path?
answer: This is not the question, the question is whether you have the necessary aspiration, determination and perseverance and whether you can by the intensity and persistence of your aspiration make all the parts of your being answer to the call and become one in the consecration.

questions: What is meant by spiritual 'opening'?
Where should I open myself spiritually?
answer: An inner purity and receptivity that freely lets in the Mother's influence. Begin with the heart.

questions: What is the psychic being?
What is the vital being?
answer: Psychic: your true being, the being that is in the heart and that is the spark of the Mother's own consciousness. Vital: the part from which proceed desires and hunger and dynamic activities, having its physical basis round about the navel.

questions: What are three indispensable things to begin sadhana with?
answer: Three things indispensable to begin with: Absolute sincerity in the whole being and all its activities. Complete self-surrender without any reservation. Patient work on oneself and at the same time a steady conquering of perfect unshakable peace and equanimity.

questions: What qualities are needed for the different types of examinations or trials in life?
answer: Endurance and plasticity, cheerfulness and fearlessness are the qualities specially needed for the examinations of physical nature. Aspiration, trust, idealism, enthusiasm and generous self-giving, for spiritual examinations. Vigilance, sincerity and humility for the examinations from hostile forces.

questions: Should I see myself as an examiner of others?
answer: Never set yourself up as an examiner. For while it is good to remember constantly that one may be undergoing a very important examination, it is extremely dangerous to imagine that one is responsible for setting examinations for others. That is the open door to the most ridiculous and harmful kinds of vanity.

questions: What is Tapasya in a spiritual context?
answer: A discipline imposed by the will for any spiritual end is tapasya. Integral tapasya: the whole being lives only to know and serve the Divine.

questions: What distinguishes a human from an animal regarding discipline?
answer: Without discipline one is only an animal. One begins to be a man only when one aspires to a higher and truer life and when one accepts a discipline of transformation.

questions: What is the true spiritual attitude regarding asceticism and desire?
answer: The true attitude is neither to be an ascetic nor to indulge in desire. The true attitude is to take in all simplicity what I give, to be perfectly satisfied with it and neither to ask for more nor to refuse what is given.

questions: Is fasting necessary to obtain Truth?
answer: It is not by fasting but by improving the will that one obtains the Truth.

questions: Should I spend time in solitude for my spiritual practice?
answer: It is the old methods of yoga which demand silence and solitude. The yoga of tomorrow is to find the Divine in work and in relation with the world. Look within yourself, reflect upon it and tell me what your choice is.

questions: How important is concentrated attention for success?
answer: It is said that the faculty of concentrated attention is at the source of all successful activity. Indeed the capacity and value of a man can be measured by his capacity of concentrated attention.

questions: What is the ideal way to approach meditation?
answer: When you sit in meditation you must be as candid and simple as a child, not interfering by your external mind, expecting nothing, insisting on nothing. Once this condition is there, all the rest depends upon the aspiration deep within you.

questions: Is it useful to increase time for meditation if my mind is still very active?
answer: The increase of time given to meditation is not very useful unless the urge for meditation comes spontaneously from inside and not from any arbitrary decision of the mind.

questions: What is more important: fixed hours of meditation or a constant in-gathered attitude?
answer: To keep constantly a concentrated and in-gathered attitude is more important than having fixed hours of meditation.

questions: What does spiritual experience mean?
answer: Spiritual experience means the contact with the Divine in oneself (or without, which comes to the same thing in that domain). And it is an experience identical everywhere in all countries, among all peoples and even in all ages.

questions: Should I control my spiritual experiences or be controlled by them?
answer: It is always better to control an experience of this kind rather than to be controlled by it. I mean that the experience in itself is good and useful, but it must come when we want it to come and not at any time when it chooses to come.

questions: What is the beginning or foundation of yoga?
answer: The descent of calm and light into the being is the beginning of the foundation of the yoga.

questions: What is the best attitude when experiencing descents of spiritual force or energy?
answer: The best attitude is to be quiet and calm, and to let the experience follow its course, observing it *without thinking about it*. In order that the experience may not be dangerously deformed and painful, one should keep an absolute calm. It is only in the peace and the calm that the Divine Force expresses itself and acts.

questions: What is the cause of difficulties in sadhana?
Why do I face resistances in my spiritual practice?
answer: The difficulties are always due to a resistance, some part or several parts of the being refusing to receive the force, the consciousness and the light put upon them and revolting against the divine influence. To keep steady one's aspiration and to look at oneself with an absolute sincerity are the sure means to overcome all obstacles.
citation: [wotm2, The Cause and Utility of Difficulties]

questions: What is the utility of difficulties?
Are difficulties sent to make realization more perfect?
answer: Difficulties are sent to us exclusively to make the realisation more perfect. Each time we try to realise something and meet with a resistance or an obstacle or even a failure—what seems to be a failure—we should know, we should never forget that it is exclusively, absolutely, so that the realisation may be more perfect.
citation: [wotm2, The Cause and Utility of Difficulties]

questions: How should one view shocks and trials in life?
answer: Shocks and trials always come as a divine grace to show us the points in our being where we fall short and the movements in which we turn our back on our soul by listening to the clamour of our mental being and vital being. If we know how to accept these spiritual blows with due humility, we are sure to cover a great distance at a single bound.
citation: [wotm2, The Cause and Utility of Difficulties]

questions: Should I complain about difficulties on the path of perfection?
answer: He who wants to advance on the path of perfection must never complain about the difficulties on the way, for each is an opportunity for a new progress. To complain is a sign of weakness and insincerity.

questions: Does worrying about difficulties help?
answer: Never worry. Do with sincerity all you do and leave the results to the Divine's care. Don't foresee difficulties—it does not help to surmount them and helps them to come.

questions: What happens if I keep thinking about a difficulty?
answer: Never think of a difficulty—you give it strength. If you go on thinking of the trouble, it will go on increasing. If you concentrate upon it, it will swell up, it will think that it is being welcomed. But if you don't pay any attention, it will lose interest in you and go away.

questions: What is the best way to make mistakes disappear?
answer: When a mistake is made, it must always be used as a means for progress; once the necessary change is realised, the mistake and its cause disappear and there can be no repetition.

questions: Should I torment myself over errors I commit?
answer: One must not torment oneself over errors that one may commit, but one must keep *a perfect sincerity in one's aspiration* and in the end everything will be all right. It is good to recognise your mistakes, but you must not torment yourself. You must not suffer, you must correct yourself instead.
citation: [wotm2, Mistakes: No Torment, Worry or Sadness]

questions: What is the best protection against negative influences?
How can I be safe on the spiritual path?
answer: Honesty is the best protection. Never tell a lie: absolute condition for safety on the path.

questions: What is more important, control over speech or complete silence?
answer: Control over what one says is more important than complete silence. The best is to learn to say what is useful in the most exact and true way possible.

questions: What is the value of speaking little and acting more?
answer: Speak less, act more. A drop of practice is better than an ocean of theories, advices and good resolutions.

questions: How does one get rid of vanity and selfishness?
answer: By a complete consecration to the Divine and a loving surrender to the Divine's Will.

questions: Is ambition a problem in spiritual life?
answer: Ambition is always a source of disturbance and confusion. Action without ambition and egoistic calculation is the condition of peace and felicity—both inner and outer.

questions: Why do I feel jealous?
Is there any reason for jealousy?
answer: There is never any reason for jealousy. It is a very low and ignorant movement. Jealousy comes from a narrowness of the mind and a weakness of the heart.

questions: What is your view on quarrels?
answer: You must never forget that I disapprove of quarrels and always consider that both sides are equally wrong. When two persons quarrel, always both are in the wrong. It is always wrong to quarrel, even if one is not the aggressor.

questions: How can I develop my will power?
What if I don't have a strong will?
answer: One must have an unvarying will to acquire what one does not have in one's nature, to know what one does not yet know, to be able to do what one cannot yet do. If one has a strong will, he has only to orient it properly; if he has no will, he has first of all to build one for himself, which always takes long and is sometimes difficult.

questions: Are beautiful thoughts enough for spiritual progress?
answer: Even the most beautiful thoughts will not make us progress unless we have a constant will for them to be expressed in us through nobler feelings, more exact sensations and better actions.

questions: How important is it to be patient in spiritual life?
answer: Perseverance is patience in action. With patience one arrives always. It is not in a day that one can overcome one's own nature. But with patience and enduring will the Victory is sure to come.

questions: What does it mean to be heroic in a spiritual sense?
answer: Heroism is to be able to stand for the Truth in all circumstances, to declare it amidst opposition and to fight for it whenever necessary. And to act always from one's highest consciousness.

questions: Is it important to be courageous in spiritual life?
answer: Courage is a sign of the soul's nobility. But courage must be calm and master of itself, generous and benevolent. In true courage there is no impatience and no rashness.

questions: What is the source of true strength?
answer: The true strength is always peaceful. All who are truly strong and powerful are always very calm. It is only the weak who are restless. True calmness is always a sign of forcefulness.

questions: How can I ensure harmony in my interactions or work?
answer: For harmony and better work, it is not by changing men that things can get better, but by changing one's own consciousness and character.

questions: Is it okay to judge others if I see their faults?
answer: The more a mind is ignorant, the more easily it judges everything it does not know or is incapable of understanding. Before deciding that something is wrong in others or in circumstances, you must be quite sure of the correctness of your judgment—and what judgment is correct so long as one lives in the ordinary consciousness that is based on ignorance and filled with falsehood? Only the Truth-Consciousness can judge.

questions: What is the best way to help other people?
answer: To help others is the best way of helping oneself. For, if you are sincere, you will soon discover that all their difficulties and all their failures are the sure signs of the same corresponding deficiency in you. The best way of helping others is to transform oneself.

questions: Should I be affected by what other people think or say about me?
answer: To feel hurt by what others do or think or say is always a sign of weakness and proof that the whole being is not exclusively turned towards the Divine, not under the divine influence alone. What people think, do or say is of little importance. The only thing that counts is your relation with the Divine.

questions: What is the nature of human relationships compared to connection with the Divine?
answer: All that is based on human relationship is unstable and transient, mixed and unsatisfactory; it is only what is established in the Divine and through the Divine that can last and give satisfaction.

questions: What is my primary duty if I have dedicated myself to the Divine?
answer: Duty towards the Divine is far more sacred than any social or family duty. One who has given himself to the Divine has no longer any other duty than to make that consecration more and more perfect.
citation: [wotm2, Duty towards the Divine and Others]

questions: How can women achieve equality with men?
answer: No law can liberate women unless they liberate themselves. What makes them slaves is: (1) Attraction towards the male and his strength, (2) Desire for home life and its security, (3) Attachment to motherhood. If they get free from these three slaveries, they will truly be the equal of men.

questions: What is the secret of a lasting union in marriage?
answer: To be one in aspiration and ascension, to move forward at the same pace on the same spiritual path, that is the secret of a lasting union.

questions: How should I approach my work if I want to progress spiritually?
answer: You must do the work as an offering to the Divine and take it as part of your Sadhana. In that spirit the nature of the work is of little importance and you can do any work without losing the contact with the inner presence. Work done in the true spirit is meditation.
citation: [wotm2, Work as on Offering to the Divine]

questions: How can I achieve perfection in my work?
answer: Perfection in the work must be the aim, but it is only by a very patient effort that this can be obtained. Let nothing short of perfection be your ideal in work and you are sure to become a true instrument of the Divine.

questions: What should I do if I'm not interested in the work I have?
answer: Try to enjoy doing everything you do. When you are interested in what you do, you enjoy doing it. To be interested in what you do, you must try to do it better and better. In progress lies true joy. Any work done with care becomes interesting.

questions: Is it okay to change my work if I face difficulties or don't like it?
answer: I do not believe that to change work will help you to change your character; it has never proved successful before. The reasons for which you ask to change your work are psychological and do not depend on the work itself. Wherever you will go, you will carry them with you and nowhere will you be able to find peace unless you have the peace in your heart.

questions: Why is it important to take care of material things?
answer: Not to take care of material things which one uses is a sign of inconscience and ignorance. You have no right to use any material object whatsoever if you do not take care of it. You must take care of it not because you are attached to it, but because it manifests something of the Divine Consciousness.

questions: What is the soul?
answer: The soul is that which comes out of the Divine without ever leaving Him and goes back to Him without ever ceasing from manifestation. The soul is the Divine made individual without ceasing to be divine. In the soul the individual and the Divine are eternally one.

questions: How can I stop my mind from doubting so much?
Is it normal for the physical mind to doubt?
answer: One of the chief functions of the physical mind is to doubt. If you listen to it, it will always find a thousand reasons for doubting. But you must know that the physical mind is working in ignorance and full of falsehoods.

questions: How can I make my mind silent?
What is needed to receive divine answers or guidance?
answer: Practise *silence* of mind, it gives power of understanding. The brain blank, immobile and turned upward. This is the necessary condition to receive the answers. If you can hand over the care of your existence and your development to the Supreme Consciousness, then peace will enter your heart and your problems will be solved.
citation: [wotm2, Quiet Mind, Calm Mind, Silent Mind]

questions: What is the heart's role in understanding spiritual matters?
answer: It is the heart that has wings, not the head. Read with your heart and you will understand.

questions: What is the vital being's main characteristic?
answer: The vital is the seat of our power, energy, enthusiasm, effective dynamism. It needs a systematic education. The vital by nature is unsteady and always wants new things.

questions: How do our senses perceive truth?
answer: The senses are liars—they do not convey to us the truth of things but only an incomplete and even falsified appearance of things.

questions: Where can I find what I truly need in life?
What is the source of all necessities?
answer: It is in the Divine that we shall always find all that we need.

questions: How can I feel completely safe?
Is there anything that offers perfect safety?
answer: Alone the Divine can give us a perfect safety.

questions: What should guide my life's power and decisions?
answer: Let the Divine Consciousness be the leading power in your life.

questions: How can I make progress in my spiritual life?
What is the foundation for all progress?
answer: Simple sincerity: the beginning of all progress.

questions: What does it mean to be perfectly sincere?
What is required for my life to become harmonious and beautiful?
answer: Be perfectly sincere in your consecration to the Divine and your life will become harmonious and beautiful. Fear not, your sincerity is your safeguard.

questions: What happens if I truly desire only the Divine?
answer: If earnestly you say to the Divine, "I want only Thee", the Divine will arrange the circumstances in such a way that you are compelled to be sincere.

questions: What kind of aspiration can reach great heights?
Is there a limit to what aspiration can achieve?
answer: The urge of aspiration: nothing is too high, nothing too far for its insatiable ardour.

questions: Is it harmful to express my aspirations?
answer: It never does any harm to express an aspiration—that gives force to it.

questions: How can I ensure my aspiration leads to progress?
What if my demands are mixed with my aspiration?
answer: Aspiration is *always* good, and if some demand is mixed up with it, you can be sure that it will not be granted. Go on aspiring and the necessary progress is bound to come.

questions: How should my faith be, especially in difficult times?
answer: True faith does not depend on circumstances. Faith is the surest guide in the darkest days.

questions: What is the relationship between faith and knowledge?
answer: Faith first, knowledge afterwards.

questions: How does the purity of faith affect what happens to me?
answer: At every moment all the unforeseen, the unexpected, the unknown is before us—and what happens to us depends mostly on the intensity and purity of our faith.

questions: Is it okay to always call for spiritual help?
What is the difference between calling for help and selfishly pulling forces?
answer: There is certainly a great difference between calling and pulling—you can and must always call for help and the rest—the answer will be proportionate to your capacity of reception and assimilation. Pulling is a selfish movement that may bring down forces quite disproportionate to your capacities and thus are harmful.

questions: What should I pray for, justice or Divine Grace?
answer: It is the Divine Grace that must be prayed for—if justice were to manifest, very few would be those who could stand in front of it.

questions: What is the main work of an Avatar, like Sri Aurobindo?
How does the Mother relate to Divine Grace and Justice?
answer: The great work of the Avatar is to manifest the Divine Grace upon earth. To be a disciple of the Avatar is to become an instrument of the Divine Grace. The Mother is the great dispensatrix—through identity—of the Divine Grace, with a perfect knowledge—through identity—of the absolute mechanism of Universal Justice.

questions: How can I receive more of the Divine's love and other gifts?
answer: The Grace is equally for all. But each one receives it according to his sincerity. It does not depend on outward circumstances but on a sincere aspiration and openness.

questions: My heart feels arid and gloomy, what can I do?
answer: Why don't you try to read something beautiful and interesting and turn your attention away from yourself? That is the best remedy.

questions: What is the main cause of depression and how can I overcome it?
answer: It is the ego that gets depressed. Do not mind it. Go on quietly with your work and the depression will disappear.

questions: What is the root of fear?
How can I stop feeling afraid?
answer: It is the fear—more or less conscious—which does almost all the mischief. Without fear *nothing* can happen. Stop fearing and the bothers will stop also.

questions: What is the connection between fear and yoga?
answer: Yoga and fear do not go together. All fear must be overcome and replaced by a total confidence in the Divine Grace.

questions: What should be my approach to hardships in life?
How does the Divine Grace relate to difficult situations?
answer: In any case and whatever happens, always consider events as a gift from the Divine Grace which is leading you by swift paths towards the spiritual goal of your life.

questions: Does Divine Grace mean an easy life without problems?
answer: People believe that the Grace means making everything smooth for all your life. It is not true. The Grace works for the realisation of your aspiration and everything is arranged to gain the most prompt, the quickest realisation.

questions: What makes an action truly spiritual or 'yogic'?
answer: It is the spirit and the consciousness from which it is done that makes an action yogic; it is not the action itself.

questions: Can even seemingly useless acts be productive in a spiritual sense?
answer: Whatever one does, it becomes useful if one puts a spark of true consciousness into it. The consciousness one has is much more important than the act one performs. And the most apparently useless acts can become very productive if they are performed with the true consciousness.

questions: How does concentration help in development?
answer: Concentration on a precise goal is helpful to development. The more we concentrate on the goal, the more it blossoms forth and becomes precise.

questions: What is the value of remaining silent instead of complaining?
How should I react to difficult circumstances or people?
answer: Where the two extremes meet, to complain of anything at all, of oneself, of others or of circumstances, is a weakness and an insincerity towards one's supreme Self. Never grumble. All sorts of forces enter you when you grumble and they pull you down. Keep smiling.

questions: What's the best way to deal with small, unimportant difficulties?
Should I focus on my difficulties or my ideal?
answer: We must always keep in mind the big ideal and work that is to be achieved so that we should not give too much importance to small details, trifles that must not draw our attention; let them come, let them go like small clouds in the sky, which do not affect the fine weather.

questions: How can past errors be fixed or their consequences removed?
Is there hope if I have made many mistakes?
answer: If errors and mistakes could not be effaced at every moment, there would be no hope of salvation for the world. Once the progress has been made, the consequences of past errors, if there are any, disappear through the intervention of the divine Grace.

questions: Is it good to feel unworthy because of my mistakes?
How should I feel when I realize my unworthiness?
answer: If the sense of unworthiness fills you with overflowing gratitude and throws you at Sri Aurobindo's feet in an ecstasy of joy, then you can know that it comes from a true source; if, on the contrary, it makes you miserable and brings an impulse to hide or to run away, then you can be sure that its origin is hostile.
citation: [wotm2, Mistakes: No Torment, Worry or Sadness]

questions: What is the best way to protect myself spiritually?
How important is honesty on the spiritual path?
answer: Honesty is the best protection. A peaceful heart is the best reward of honesty.

questions: How can I avoid troubles that come from speaking?
Is it better to remain silent or to speak carefully?
answer: If only people did remain a little quiet before speaking, acting or writing, much trouble could be avoided. So many things are said uselessly, they bring misunderstandings and bad feelings which could have been saved with silence.

questions: Is it enough to know spiritual teachings, or is practice necessary?
answer: It is not enough to know, you must *practise*. It is not enough to pretend, you must *be*. A little bit of sincere practice is worth much more than a lot of written or spoken words.

questions: What prevents me from feeling the Divine's help and love?
answer: Selfishness and self-pity lead nowhere. You would do better to get rid of them—for it is these two narrow movements which prevent you from feeling the Divine's help and love.

questions: What is the impact of ambition on spiritual life?
answer: Ambition is always a source of disturbance and confusion.

questions: What is the root cause of jealousy?
answer: Jealousy comes from a narrowness of the mind and a weakness of the heart. It is a great pity that so many are attacked by it.

questions: How can I avoid quarrels and maintain peace?
answer: Keep this attitude—never side with anybody nor take up any personal quarrel—think only of the Divine Peace, Harmony, Light and Happiness and become more and more their purified and quiet instrument.

questions: How can I ensure I reach my spiritual goal if I face many obstacles?
What is the key to conquering difficulties on the path?
answer: Persevere—it is the surest way to success. What you have not been able to achieve in you last year, you will do this year. It is by *persevering* that one conquers difficulties, not by running away from them. One who perseveres is sure to triumph.

questions: Is there any value in being obstinate?
How can obstinacy be useful?
answer: It is the wrong use of a great quality—perseverance. Make a good use of it and it will be all right. Be obstinate in your effort towards progress, and your obstinacy will become useful.

questions: What does it mean to be truly heroic?
How should a spiritual warrior act?
answer: Heroism is to be able to stand for the Truth in all circumstances, to declare it amidst opposition and to fight for it whenever necessary. And to act always from one's highest consciousness. We aspire to be the valiant warriors of the Lord so that His glory may manifest upon the earth.

questions: What is considered a noble form of courage?
answer: A noblest courage is to recognise one's faults. There is no greater courage than that of recognising one's own mistakes. There is no greater courage than to be always truthful.

questions: How does true strength manifest?
Is being restless a sign of weakness?
answer: The true strength is always peaceful. All who are truly strong and powerful are always very calm. It is only the weak who are restless. True calmness is always a sign of forcefulness.

questions: What is the power of integral silence?
answer: Integral silence: the source of true force.

questions: What is the nature of the soul?
How does the soul relate to the Divine?
answer: The soul is divine, an eternal portion of the Supreme Divine and therefore cannot be limited or bound by any law whatever, other than its own. These souls are emanated by the Lord to do His work in the world.

questions: Can the soul think about the Divine?
answer: The soul cannot think the Divine but knows Him with certitude.

questions: What should I do if my mind gives me favorable explanations for my mistakes?
answer: Guard against the twist, be conscious of the passion. There is the habit of always furnishing in the presence of a mistake a *favourable explanation*—this favourable explanation seems to jump out from the mind spontaneously and automatically—trying to obviate any sincere recognition of the error.

questions: Can my thoughts create suffering for me?
answer: Those who think falsely will live in falsehood and misery. Get out of wrong thinking and you will get out of suffering. An old wise man in China has written, "Thought creates for itself its own suffering."

questions: What is the main function of the physical mind that can hinder me?
Why does my mind always find reasons to doubt?
answer: One of the chief functions of the physical mind is to doubt. If you listen to it, it will always find a thousand reasons for doubting. But you must know that the physical mind is working in ignorance and full of falsehoods.

questions: How can I receive answers from you or the Divine directly?
What is true meditation for receiving guidance?
answer: You are capable of receiving these answers directly, but for that you must learn to keep your mind silent—this is the true meditation—the brain blank, immobile and turned upward. This is the necessary condition to receive the answers.
citation: [wotm2, Quiet Mind, Calm Mind, Silent Mind]

questions: If I want to solve my problems and find peace, what should I do?
answer: If you can hand over the care of your existence and your development to the Supreme Consciousness, then peace will enter your heart and your problems will be solved.
citation: [wotm2, Quiet Mind, Calm Mind, Silent Mind]

questions: What is the nature of the vital being within us?
answer: The vital is the seat of our power, energy, enthusiasm, effective dynamism. It needs a systematic education. The vital by nature is unsteady and always wants new things.

questions: How can the vital being be made to serve the Divine?
When can the vital's power of expression be useful?
answer: Power of vital expression is useful only when the vital is converted. Unless it is converted and becomes a docile servant of the Divine, things are always fluctuating.

questions: What happens to our senses when we are surrendered to Truth?
answer: Purified senses can be obtained only by a total surrender to the Truth.

questions: How should I live if I want to be close to the Divine?
What is a fundamental requirement for spiritual life?
answer: Absolute truthfulness must govern life if one wants to be close to the Divine. Only those who are perfectly truthful can be my true children.

questions: What is the power of Truth?
Where can I find refuge?
answer: Take Truth for your force, take Truth for your refuge.

questions: What is needed to overcome all difficulties related to falsehood?
answer: Once falsehood is conquered, all difficulties will go.

questions: Are there many truths or only one?
answer: There is one Truth but a million ways of distorting it in the attempt to express it.

questions: How can I get closer to understanding Truth if it's beyond words?
answer: Truth cannot be formulated in words, but it can be lived provided one is pure and plastic enough. To come closer to the Truth, you must often accept not to understand.

questions: What is intellectual Truth, and what is practical Truth?
answer: Intellectually, the Truth is the point where all the opposites meet and join to make a unity. Practically, the Truth is the surrender of the ego, to make possible the birth and manifestation of the Divine.

questions: What is the main source of bitterness in life?
answer: All bitterness in life *always* comes from the ego refusing to abdicate.

questions: How can I achieve peace for myself and others?
answer: All that happens is to teach us one and the same lesson, unless we get rid of our ego there is no peace either for ourselves or for others. And without ego life becomes such a wonderful marvel!...

questions: How is the size of my ego related to my difficulties?
answer: The extent of your difficulties gives you the measure of your ego.

questions: What is the wisest way to approach my life's responsibilities?
How can I ensure my life is guided by the Divine?
answer: Surrender: the decision to hand over the responsibility of your life to the Divine. This is done either through the mind or the emotion or the life-impulse or through all of them together.

questions: What happens when one truly surrenders to the Divine?
Can surrender increase my capacity?
answer: True surrender enlarges you; it increases your capacity; it gives you a greater measure in quality and in quantity, which you could not have had yourself.

questions: What does it mean to truly love the Divine?
What is the nature of pure love for the Divine?
answer: The true love for the Divine is self-giving, free of demand, full of submission and surrender. It makes no claim, imposes no condition, strikes no bargain, indulges in no violences of jealousy or pride or anger—for these things are not in its composition.

questions: What if I offer love to the Divine, but it doesn't seem to be accepted or things go wrong?
answer: When the true and sacred love is there (love *from* the Divine and *for* the Divine), whatever happens is always utilised as a means for increasing and perfecting the union. This leaves no place for worry, regret and depression, but, on the contrary, fills the consciousness with the certitude of victory.

questions: How can I feel the Divine's love in everything around me?
answer: When you reach the contact with the Divine's love you see this love in everything and all circumstances.

questions: How does judging others affect them and myself?
Why should I avoid thinking badly of people?
answer: The first necessity is to abstain from thinking of anyone in a depreciatory way. When we meet a person, our criticising thoughts give to him, so to say, a blow on the nose which naturally creates a revolt in him. It is our mental formation that acts like a deforming mirror to that person.

questions: How can I become more understanding and less critical of others?
What is the relationship between my own perfection and how I see others?
answer: With our own perfection grows in us a generous understanding of others. Be severe to yourself before being severe to others.

questions: What is the most effective way to bring about positive change in the world?
If I want to help the world, where should I start?
answer: The best way of helping the world is to transform oneself by an *integral* and *intensive* yoga. Change yourself if you wish to change the world.

questions: How do my inner errors affect the world around me?
answer: The ills that humanity suffers from—collectively and individually—stem from the errors that lie at the roots of our ignorant nature. We must be cleansed of these evils—individually first of all—if we ever hope to see a clean world outside.

questions: How much importance should I give to what other people think of me?
answer: Don't let anything from outside approach and disturb you. What people think, do or say is of little importance. The only thing that counts is your relation with the Divine.

questions: What does it mean if I feel hurt by what others say or do?
answer: To feel hurt by what others do or think or say is always a sign of weakness and proof that the whole being is not exclusively turned towards the Divine, not under the divine influence alone.

questions: How can I avoid getting into conflict when others have different viewpoints?
answer: The ego never understands that the Divine has different workings in different people and that to judge things from one's own egoistic point of view is a great mistake bound to increase the confusion. What we do with passion and intolerance cannot be divine, because the Divine works only in peace and harmony.

questions: Are friendships and intimate relationships a hindrance to spiritual practice?
What is the risk of forming close human ties in sadhana?
answer: One must always be wary of the subconscious and that is why it is always preferable to have no particular friendships and intimacies, because in the subconscious vital, ties are established which form an obstacle to the sadhana.

questions: How can I make my human relationships pure and helpful for my spiritual growth?
answer: It is true that it is extremely difficult to keep free from vital mixture any close relation with human beings. But the remedy is not to cut all such relations, but to be constantly vigilant (on one's guard) and not to allow the vital attractiveness to rule one's actions.

questions: What is my foremost duty if I have given myself to the Divine?
Are family or social duties more important than my duty to the Divine?
answer: Duty towards the Divine is far more sacred than any social or family duty; it is all the more sacred because within the human collectivity it is almost wholly ignored or misunderstood. One who has given himself to the Divine has no longer any other duty than to make that consecration more and more perfect.
citation: [wotm2, Duty towards the Divine and Others]

questions: What should be my attitude if the world misunderstands or condemns my spiritual path?
answer: You should not attempt to convince; above all, you should not let yourself be touched or shaken. You must shut yourself carefully within your ivory tower of consecration and await from the Divine alone help, protection, guidance and *approbation*. To be condemned by the whole world is nothing to him who knows that he has the approval of the Divine and his support.
citation: [wotm2, Duty towards the Divine and Others]

questions: What truly makes women slaves, and how can they be liberated?
answer: No law can liberate women unless they liberate themselves. What makes them slaves is: (1) Attraction towards the male and his strength, (2) Desire for home life and its security, (3) Attachment to motherhood. If they get free from these three slaveries, they will truly be the equal of men.

questions: Are women inherently more bound to vital and material consciousness than men?
Is it easier for women to find their psychic being?
answer: Women are not more bound to the vital and material consciousness than men are. On the contrary, as they have not, in general, the arrogant mental pretensions of men, it is easier for them to discover their psychic being and to allow it to guide them.

questions: What is the true foundation of marriage beyond material and emotional aspects?
answer: To unite your physical lives, your material interests, to become partners... that is the very foundation of marriage, but... it is not enough. To be one in aspiration and ascension, to move forward at the same pace on the same spiritual path, that is the secret of a lasting union.

questions: Is getting married a direct way to prepare for sadhana?
answer: Marriage is not a direct way to prepare oneself for sadhana. It can be an indirect one if the outward nature needs troubles and disappointments to get rid of all worldly attachments, but in that case the experiment usually ends by separation and often a painful one.

questions: How can I best use my work for spiritual growth?
What is the significance of work in sadhana?
answer: Let us offer our work to the Divine; this is the sure means of progressing. Consciousness develops best through work done as an offering to the Divine. To work for the Divine is to pray with the body.
citation: [wotm2, Work as on Offering to the Divine]

questions: Is meditation more effective than work for spiritual progress?
answer: One can progress through meditation, but through work provided it is done in the right spirit one can progress ten times more.
citation: [wotm2, Work as on Offering to the Divine]

questions: How should I treat material objects I use?
Is there a spiritual reason to take care of things?
answer: Not to take care of material things which one uses is a sign of inconscience and ignorance. You have no right to use any material object whatsoever if you do not take care of it. You must take care of it not because you are attached to it, but because it manifests something of the Divine Consciousness.

questions: How can I find joy and peace deep within my heart?
What is always present in the heart?
answer: A great joy is always deep in our heart, and always we can find it there. In the silence of our heart there is always peace and joy.

questions: What is needed to understand the mystery of incarnation?
answer: In the silence of a simple and faithful heart one can understand the mystery of incarnation.

questions: What is the origin and nature of Divine Love?
Why did Love come into the manifestation?
answer: When Consciousness separated from its Origin and became Inconscience, the Origin emanated Love to reawaken Consciousness from the depth of the Inconscience and bring it back into touch with its Origin. It may be said that at its origin love is the supreme power of attraction which awakens, in response, the irresistible need of an absolute self-giving.

questions: How can I recognize Divine Love if I don't feel it?
answer: Only he who loves can recognise love. Those who are incapable of giving themselves in a sincere love, will never recognise love anywhere, and the more the love is divine, that is to say, unselfish, the less they can recognise it.

questions: What should be the primary quality of our aspiration if we want it to be effective?
How does the Divine respond to sincere aspiration?
answer: It is to the sincerity of your aspiration that the Love answers spontaneously.

questions: What is the consequence of trying to satisfy desires?
How can I truly overcome my desires?
answer: Yielding to desires is not the way of getting rid of them. There is no end to desires—each one which is satisfied is at once replaced by another one and they go on clamouring more and more. It is only by conquering the desires that you can get rid of them, by coming out of this consciousness of the lower nature and rising to a higher consciousness.

questions: What is the first step towards spiritual realization concerning impulses?
How important is self-control?
answer: Control over the lower impulsions is the first step towards realisation. There is no greater victory than that of controlling oneself.

questions: What is the main characteristic of the ego?
How does the soul's awareness differ from the ego's?
answer: The ego thinks of what it wants and has not. This is its constant preoccupation. The soul is aware of what it is given and lives in endless gratitude.

questions: If my nature is rigid, can work help me become more flexible?
answer: But through work the nature becomes less rigid, more plastic and supple.

questions: What should I do if I feel I don't have the strength or grace to do my work?
answer: Here, for each work given, the full strength and Grace are always given at the same time to do the work as it has to be done. If you do not feel the strength and the Grace, it proves that there is some mistake in your attitude. The faith is lacking or you have fallen back on old tracks and old creeds and thus you lose all receptivity.

questions: How should I view the resistance I meet when trying to accomplish important work?
answer: The resistance with which we meet in the accomplishment of our work is proportionate to its importance.

questions: What is the importance of confidence in the Divine Grace?
How does trust affect the Divine's help?
answer: An absolute faith and trust in the Grace is, in the last analysis, the Supreme Wisdom. It is in proportion to our trust in the Divine that the Divine Grace can act for us and help.
citation: [wotm2, Faith in the Divine Grace and Help]
